structuralFindings.rationale: Based on existing specimen classification. New observations from earnings/research session.

quotes.text: You should note the impact of Zelle and the continued user growth, and also the impact of Erica, our AI agent.
quotes.speaker: Brian Moynihan
quotes.context: Q4 2025 earnings call — notable for explicitly calling Erica an 'AI agent' (agentic framing)

quotes.text: We saw productivity improvements through AI and digitalization more generally, and those enabled us to add client-facing associates as we eliminated work and roles.
quotes.speaker: Alastair Borthwick
quotes.context: Explaining how AI-driven productivity allows redeployment to client-facing roles while keeping headcount flat

sources.name: Erica evolved from chatbot to agentic AI financial coach
sources.notes: Erica evolved from chatbot to agentic AI financial coach

sources.name: $14B technology budget with $4.5B allocated to AI

summary: Erica evolved from chatbot to agentic AI financial coach: Erica has 20.6M users (up from 19.7M YoY), logging 169M interactions in Q4 2025. Evolved from simple chatbot to proactive financial coach using predictive analytics to help customers avoid overdrafts  $14B technology budget with $4.5B allocated to AI: Moynihan outlined BofA's $14 billion technology budget, with roughly $4.5 billion specifically allocated to AI initiatives. This $4.5B AI allocation is the largest disclosed AI-specific budget among t AI enables flat headcount with redeployment to client-facing roles: CFO Alastair Borthwick: 'We saw productivity improvements through AI and digitalization more generally, and those enabled us to add client-facing associates as we eliminated work and roles.' Bank main Agentic AI expected to lower efficiency ratio 100-200bps over 24 months: Management expects agentic AI to lower the bank's efficiency ratio by 100-200 basis points over the next 24 months through automated back-office operations. This is a concrete, quantified efficiency t
